pp.dorenda.client2.additional

Class UniversalPainter

  • java.lang.Object
    • pp.dorenda.client2.additional.UniversalPainter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdditionalPainter

    public class UniversalPainter
extends java.lang.Object
implements AdditionalPainter
    An additional painter that provides a lot of painting commands to paint on the map. Here the help text for this Painter: 
     Arguments: <filename>;<mappos> where ;<mappos> is optional
 If defined <mappos> gives the start centered position of the map display
  It may by one of
  <pos>, e.g. 11.15800500,49.46591000: explicit position
  s: use the first position of the given file
  c: use the overal mean of all positions in the file
  e: use the last position of the given file
         
 The file is a simple textfile that contains positions of a route, e.g.
 
 11.15800500,49.46591000
 11.16800500,49.46591000
 11.1700500,49.4671000
 
 Additional tags can configure the apperance of coordinates");
 tags may appear at any place in the sequence of coordinates and modify the sequence
 of subsequent coordiates - until the end of file or until the next tag appears.
 In the following, the tags are shown, optional modifiers are presented in < >
 
 Tags are
  POSITIONS <col=r,b,g,a> <rad=radius> <text="text"> <bar=x1,x2,...>  <barcol=c1,c2,...>: Positions are presented separately (same text for all)
  LINE <col=r,b,g,a> <mode=modenr> <rad=radius> <startflag="text"> <endflag="text"> <middleflag="text">: Positions are presented as a line
  POLYGON <col=r,b,g,a>: Positions are presented as filled closed poylgon
  MULTIPOLYGON <col=r,b,g,a>: Successing SHELL and HOLE entries are painted as Multipoly with holes
  SHELL, HOLE: Pointlists of Shell and Holes for the MULTIPOLYGON
 
 Modifiers are
   col=r,b,g,a: Color definition, each component is in 0...255
   rad=radius: Radius in pixels (or line thickness), 0 for no poly border
   text="text": an arbitrary string
   bar=x1,x2: a vector of double numbers, each a value between 0...1
   barCol=c1,c2: a vector of {1,2,3} selects color 1: red, 2: green 3: yellow
   mode=modenr: line mode 0: no markers, 1: lowdens markers, 2: all markers, 3: numbers 4: arrows
   startflag="text": displays a start flag with text
   endflag="text": displays an end flag with text
   middleflag="text": displays flag with text in the middle
 
 Example
 POSITIONS col=100,0,0,100 rad=20
 11.15800500,49.46591000
 11.16800500,49.46591000
 11.1700500,49.4671000
 LINE col=255,255,255,100 mode=1 startflag="Start" endflag="Destination!"
 ...
 POLYGON col=255,255,0,100
 ...
 MULTIPOLYGON col=255,255,0,100
 SHELL
 ...
 SHELL
 ...
 HOLE
 ...
